intro: Pithecellobium mindanaense, commonly known as the Mindanao acacia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a pod that contains several seeds, and it is often found in secondary forests and along roadsides. The plant has some ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
